bug.author: PingjunChen
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ 'ApproximateGP' ImportError</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
** Code snippet to reproduce ** from gpytorch.models import ApproximateGP ** Stack trace/error message ** <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ImportError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-1-bb3a720fdf62> in <module> ----> 1 from gpytorch.models import ApproximateGP
ImportError: cannot import name 'ApproximateGP' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected Behavior</denchmark-h>
Import without error. I tried this import on multiple machines, including two ubuntu machines and one Mac, all have this import error. <denchmark-h:h2>System information</denchmark-h>
GPyTorch Version: 0.3.6 PyTorch Version: 1.3.1 Computer OS: ubuntu 16.04 LTS

comments.comment: ApproximateGP is only available on the master branch of GPyTorch right now. You can install it using pip install git+https://github.com/cornellius-gp/gpytorch.git. We will be cutting a new release very shortly.
